title: Where to get a COVID-19 vaccine in Maryland
body: Every Marylander older than 16 is now eligible to get a COVID-19 vaccine at all providers. This information will be updated as more details are released.|| COVID-19 updates | Maryland's latest numbers | Get tested | Vaccine Info ||Maryland surpassed the milestone of 5 million COVID-19 vaccines administered, per the data reported on May 6.Maryland online vaccination site locatorVaccine Data DashboardMaryland vaccination plan FAQsPhase 3: Every Marylander older than 16 eligible for vaccineMaryland on April 6 opened eligibility to every single Marylander 16 and older to get a COVID-19 vaccine appointment at state-run mass vaccination sites. Starting April 12, all providers must open eligibility to all Marylanders 16 and older.Retailers offering COVID-19 vaccineSome major retailers in Maryland are offering the vaccine as it becomes available. Click the links below for information:CVS (story here)Giant Food (now offering walk-up vaccines/no appointment needed)Rite AidSafewayWalgreensHospitals offering COVID-19 vaccineAdventist HealthCareGreater Baltimore Medical CenterLifeBridge HealthMedStar HealthMaryland Mass Vaccination SitesGo to
